newsitem.title: USA: MGE spring wheat ends mixed, new contract lows set.
newsitem.headline: MGE spring wheat ends mixed, new contract lows set.

text.p: MGE spring wheat futures settled mostly lower and near their new contract lows, but traders said commercial buying supported the December contract over deferred months, traders said.
"We're seeing the same thing day after day -- good commercial buying on the breaks. That's what's keeping us rangebound," a Minneapolis broker said.
U.S. wheat markets were weaker Tuesday after the Australian Bureau of Agricultural and Resource Economics revised upward its estimate of 1996/97 Australian wheat production.

MGE spring wheat settled eight cents a bushel lower to 3/4 cent higher, with December up 3/4 cent at $4.10-1/4. The Dec/March inverted spread widened to 13-1/2 cents from 12-1/2. March ended 3/4 cent lower at $3.96 but above its new low set during the day at $3.93-1/2. May and July also set new lows.
Traders said Wilson bought 2.5 million Dec bushels. LFG bought 600,000 each of Dec and March and sold 800,000 March and Atwood/Peavey bought 1.0 million March and sold 1.5 million Dec.
MGE barley futures closed three to five cents per cwt higher, with Dec up three cents at $6.80.
